servinfo.title: Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Components:For M16A Engine with VVT

s1.ptxt: Remove engine assembly from vehicle referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Remove cylinder head referring to Valves and Cylinder Head Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Mark cylinder number on all pistons, connecting rods and connecting rod caps using silver pencil or quick drying paint.
Install guide hose (1) over threads of rod bolts.
This prevents damage to bearing journal and rod bolt threads when removing connecting rod.
Decarbonize top of cylinder bore before removing piston from cylinder.
Push piston and connecting rod assembly out through the top of cylinder bore.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Disassembly and Assembly:For M16A Engine with VVT

s1.ptxt: Apply engine oil to pistons, rings, cylinder walls, connecting rod bearings and crank pins.

attention3.ptxt: Do not apply oil between connecting rod and bearing or between bearing cap and bearing.

s1.ptxt: Install guide hoses (1) over connecting rod bolts.
These guide hoses protect crank pin and threads of rod bolt from damage during installation of connecting rod and piston assembly.
When installing piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore, point front mark (1) on piston head to crankshaft pulley side.
Install piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore. Use special tool (Piston ring compressor) to compress rings. Guide connecting rod into place on crankshaft.
Using a hammer handle, tap piston head to install piston into bore. Hold ring compressor firmly against cylinder block until all piston rings have entered cylinder bore.
Point arrow mark (2) on cap to crankshaft pulley side.
After applying engine oil to rod bolts and tighten cap nuts (3) gradually as follows.

attention3.ptxt: If connecting rod bolt is reused, make sure to check connecting rod bolt for deformation referring to “Connecting rod bolt deformation (Plastic deformation tightening bolt)” under Piston Pins and Connecting Rods Inspection:For M16A Engine with VVT .

s2.ptxt: Tighten all cap nuts to 15 N·m (1.5 kgf-m, 11.0 lbf-ft).

torqueitem.t-note: 15 N·m (1.5 kgf-m, 11.0 lbf-ft) and then retighten by turning through 45° twice

s1.ptxt: Install cylinder head referring to Valves and Cylinder Head Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
